description: Application under s73 to remove condition 1 (wind turbines) of planning permission reference P060440 dated 26 October 2007 for the : The redevelopment of 1 Baldwin Terrace to provide 12 residential units within a contemporary  5/6 storey building; and the retention and restoration of 2 Baldwin Terrace to provide 950 sq m B1 office floor space. The proposal includes the installation of five (5no) wind turbines at roof level (four on the new 5/6 storey building and one on the retained warehouse). This application seeks to remove mention of wind turbines from the description of the proposal and remove condition 1 to enable the approved wind turbines to be replaced by photo-voltaic panels.
decision_conditions:
Energy (Compliance):

CONDITION: The development shall be carried out in accordance with the energy strategies hereby approved including ‘Energy and Renewable Statement for Proposed Development at Baldwin terrace London prepared by Building Services Design’ (BSD) dated 3rd April 2012 and ‘Energy Strategy Reassessment’ Issues B/ June 2011 prepared by Max Fordham.

REASON: In the interest of securing a sustainable development that minimises its energy use in accordance with national, regional and local policies requirements.
